alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 2:35AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of western Virginia, including the following counties: western Augusta and Highland. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 AM EST, Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monterey... Craigsville... Augusta Springs... Deerfield... Mcdowell... Liberty... Head Waters... Sirons Mill... Clover Creek... Doe Hill... Palo Alto... Possum Trot... Williamsville... Vanderpool... West Augusta... Mustoe... New Hampden... Blue Grass... Hightown... Bolar... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
